sat.title: What is a sat?
sat.text:
Sat is a small portion of a Bitcoin. The same way a dollar can be divided in 100 cents, a bitcoin can be divided in 100,000,000 sats!

Why is that important?

Divisibility is an important part of money. 

Making bitcoin extremely divisible will allow many billion of people use and own bitcoin one day. You don't need to own a full bitcoin, you can just have a fraction of it. But for now, let's just remember that sats are a small part of a bitcoin :)
sat.question: What is a sat?
answers: An alternative crypto currency
A small satellite
The smallest unit of Bitcoin
feedback: Nope, this is not another altcoin
Maybe... but that's not the right answer in this context üòÇ
You just earned 1 sat, the smallest unit of Bitcoin. Congrats!

freeMoney.title: Galoy gives me free bitcoin?
freeMoney.text:
Wait! What's the catch?

That's correct, we are giving you micro rewards so you can try bitcoin and spend some time educating yourself.

The way we think we will benefit from it is because you may consider to open an account with us if you understand more what is bitcoin and why you should care about it.
freeMoney.question: Why does Galoy gives free bitcoin?
answers: By educating yourself about bitcoin, we think you may want to get more and open an account with us
We print new bitcoin for every new customer we have to give it away
By monetizing your data with third party
feedback: You just earned another 50 sats. We hope those micro rewards will get your attention on Bitcoin
No one can print new bitcoin at will
One of the founding principle of Galoy is to respect individual privacy, so we are not looking to monetize any of your data

custody.title: What is custody?
custody.text:
Literally, custody means "the protective care or guardianship of someone or something".

Ok, that‚Äôs a boring definition, what does it mean for bitcoin or banking?

When you give your money to your bank, they are taking custody. It basically means they are taking care of it.

Regarding USD, Galoy as a bank account is no different in that regard

But with bitcoin, it's different.

You can give custody of your bitcoin to someone else, like a bank, or an exchange, but you can also take self custody of your bitcoin!

In that sense, this would be a little bit like cash. The money is in your wallet, if you lose it you‚Äôre out of luck.

For your BTC, Galoy doesn't take custody of your BTC. It is right in your phone!

Galoy is what we call a ‚Äúnon-custodial‚Äù wallet. It means the money is in your pocket, stored with some special keys on your phone!
custody.question: Which one is true?
answers: Bitcoin is like digital dollar, it has to be managed by a bank or a third party custodian
Bitcoin can be self custodied
Digital dollar can be self custodied
feedback: Unlike digital dollar, you can self custody bitcoin
You've learnt one of the important property of Bitcoin, it can be self custodied!
You can't keep your digital dollar in your wallet. It's only possible with cash

digitalKeys.title: Digital keys
digitalKeys.text:
You can compared self custodied Bitcoin with cash.

If you have a $20 bill in your pocket and you lose your wallet, you're out of luck!

For bitcoin, instead of carrying a piece of paper, you have digital keys.

Those keys allow you to spend your bitcoin, which is why making sure those keys are in a safe place is important!

A digital key is just a very, very long number (about 80 digits long!). It's astronomicaly long, so it's impossible for anyone to find it.

As a comparison, it would be easier to find a single grain of sands on earth than it would be to find a digitial key. This is the power of large number and cryptography!

This key is currently stored in a secure part of your phone.
digitalKeys.question: Which one is true?
answers: Keys allow you to recover your email and password
Keys should be shared with as many people as possible so that it won't be lost
Your keys should be kept secretly as anybody who have access to them will be able to spend your bitcoin
feedback: Unlike most existing websites, there is no way to recover your keys using your email or phone number
Digital keys are private, anyone who has access to it will be able to spend your bitcoin
Galoy is what we call a non-custodial wallet for your bitcoin. So you should take care of your keys!

backupWallet.title: Backup wallet
backupWallet.text:
Now that you have some sats, and you know what is a digital key, you can back up your wallet to iCloud so you never lose access to your bitcoin. 

Unlike traditional dollar, you own your bitcoin with keys stored in your mobile phone, which is why taking care of saving your keys is essential

fiatMoney.title: What is fiat money?
fiatMoney.text: This video will give you some insights about what is fiat money, that describe governements currency like dollars and euros
fiatMoney.question: What is backing US dollar?
answers: Gold
Fed
Ability of governement to collect taxes and repay debt
feedback: Not since the US governement ended convertability of the dollar to gold in 1971
The Fed is managing the USD currency, but is not backing it up
That's correct, the dollar is not backed by gold anymore since 1971!

bitcoinUnique.title: What makes bitcoin special?
bitcoinUnique.text:
There is a long list, and we'll go through it one by one:

- It has predictible money supply
- The money supply is capped
- It is highly divisible
- It is borderless
- Small transactions are settled in seconds, large transations take about 1h
- It can't be forged
- His creator is no longer around
bitcoinUnique.question: What are some property of bitcoin that are not present in fiat currency?
answers: It's digital money
It's the most widely accept currency across the world
It can't be forged
feedback: The dollar is already mostly digitized. Except cash, every transaction is already done in a digital form
Not yet, but maybe one day it will!
Correct. Unlike for dollar where fake bills can be make and send in circulation, it's not possible to create fake bitcoin

moneySupply.title: Bitcoin money supply
moneySupply.text:
How many bitcoin will be created and how?

21 millions bitcoin total will be created.

The reason is because this number is defined in the bitcoin software.

As it's a key reason it makes bitcoin valuable, it's unlikely each person around the world running the bitcoin software would want to update their software and change this number.

As bitcoin is decentralized and there is no one in charged, it's unlikely anyone would be able to change this parameter.
moneySupply.question: How many bitcoin will be created?
answers: There is no maximum
It's up to the central bank of Bitcoin
feedback: 21 millions, that's it!
Bitcoin money supply is capped
There is no central bank in the bitcoin protocol

newBitcoin.title: How new bitcoin are created
newBitcoin.text:
How is bitcoin being created?

Every day, there are miners who are looking for new bitcoin, solving a compute-intensive math problem. Every time they find a solution to this math problem, there are new bitcoin in existance.

It's a little bit like mining gold, where real ressources needs to be invest to find new gold, but the difference for bitcoin is that we already know the total number of bitcoin there will be in existance

volatility.title: Bitcoin volatility
volatility.text:
THIS IS NOT INVESTMENT ADVICE

Is bitcoin volatile?

Yes, it is, but why is it not a bad thing?

. Pretty much every assets, the price move when there is an imbalance between buyer and seller of an assets

 ...TODO...
volatility.question: What could drive the value of Bitcoin?
answers: It is scarse
It is a digital
It is controlled by the goverement
feedback: 21 millions bitcoin, that's it!
Bitcoin is digital, but pretty much any currency today exist in some form of digital
Bitcoin is not controlled by any government

transaction.title: Transaction with bitcoin
transaction.text:
To have an idea of how a bitcoin transaction work, we can think of a check.

If Alice wants to send $100 to Bob, Alice would write on a check $100, put Bob name as the payee, and sign. Bob doesn't really know if the money is present, but because Alice and Bob knows each other, this is fine. For a bitcoin transaction, it will be pretty much the same. Alice would sign a transaction to Bob to send some bitcoin.

The difference is that there are some cryptography involved.

Instead of signing with pen and paper, Alice will use a app, like the Galoy app, to cryptographically sign a message saying she's sending some bitcoin to Bob. and it's more secure because cryptographic are pretty much impossible to forge, unlike traditional signature. If the signature is not valid, the bitcoin network not accept the transaction
transaction.question: What makes a bitcoin transaction valid?
answers: The approval of the transaction by local gouvernement
A signature on a paper receipt, like for card transactions
Because Alice sign a transaction with her digital, cryptographic, keys
feedback: Transactions are not approved by third party or gouvernments. They just needs to confirm to the bitcoin protocol
üòÇ
That's correct, digital signature is one part of what bitcoin secure, and how transactions are being constructed!

privacy.title: Is bitcoin private?
privacy.text:
It's... complicated üôÇ

Transactions on the bitcoin are pseudonymous. It's like B5A35019 is sending money to 162BD1C0. It's not very indicative of who is sending money to who. But the difference between this and traditional payment network is that, every transaction in the protocol is public. This means everyone is the world, with an internet connection, can see that B5A35019 has sent money to 162BD1C0. For ever.

It's typically not like this in the

creator.title: Who created Bitcoin
creator.text:
Bitcoin has a unique inception story. On Decemberish 2008, a pseudonym under the name of Satoshi Nakamoto has share a paper called a 'Whitepaper' to a online group related to online money. After open sourcing the code couple of months later, and seeing other person had started contributing to the project, Natoshi Nakamo disappeared.

Is it a good thing or a bad thing?

Everybody will have their answer, but as a result of this, bitcoin is 'decentralized'. No one has really any control over it, and this is one of the strength of bitcoin, as no one is particularly in charge, it can't really be stopped.
creator.question: Who is Satoshi Nakamoto?
answers: A japanese developer
The undercover name of Craig Wright
We don't really know
feedback: Although Satoshi Nakamoto is Japan-inspired name, it is really a pseudonym
Oh, really üòÆ
The goal of Galoy is to educate you about Bitcoin, but unfortunately, we won't be able to tell you who is Satoshi Nakamoto!

decentralization.title: Bitcoin is decentralized
decentralization.question: What is a benefit of decentralization?
answers: It's harder to change, as no one party is 100% in charge. Therefore we can trust this will still be around for some time, which is a good thing for money
Protocol development happens faster than if it was centralized
It is faster to validate transactions as more computing power is involved all around the world
decentralization.feedback: The goal of Galoy is to educate you about Bitcoin, but unfortunately, we won't be able to tell you who is Satoshi Nakamoto!

scalability.title:
Does Bitcoin scale?

A common critize to Bitcoin is that this doesn't scale. The network can currently process about 7 transactions/second.

Visa, on the other side, can process 40,000 transactions/second
It's a big gap!!

But comparing visa and bitcoin is probably not that relevant. Visa aims to process transaction
